name: Ahmed Atwa
headline: Fullstack Software Engineer (MERN) | MLH Fellow Fall '22
about:
Fullstack Software Engineer with end-to-end expertise in web development, from frontend and backend to DevOps and deployment. Experienced in delivering full-stack applications using React, Node.js, and cloud platforms. Passionate about contributing to open-source, optimizing development workflows, automating deployments, and creating efficient, maintainable software solutions that scale.I've worked for numerous local and international start-ups, diving into various technological stacks, communicating and understanding their needs, creating and improving services or entire systems, from small projects to large scale, and successfully achieving their and their users' satisfaction.Before that and till now, I've been coming up with my own ideas and creating my own applications and solutions to the problems I and the people around me face daily, developing them in public and making them available for free to everyone.I'm also deeply involved in open source, contributing to public organizations and their projects and participating in open-source initiatives including MLH Fellowship and Google Summer of Code.My services include:• Frontend Web Development: Creating websites of various sizes and complexities, from simple landing pages to complex feature-packed dashboards and web applications.• Backend Development: Creating backend services and APIs to support the frontend, developing the business logic, designing and operating the database, and integrating with third-party services.• Desktop Apps Development: Creating cross-platform desktop applications that are easy and quick to run and provide more powerful features on the user's device.• Cloud Hosting & DevOps: Hosting the services on the cloud platforms, advising on the system architecture, and creating CI/CD workflows and automation pipelines.• Building systems from ideation to MVP and beyond, performing code reviews, updating and fixing existing applications, and more.Skills:• Frontend:  HTML, CSS, JavaScript, TypeScript, ReactJS, Redux, NextJS, Bootstrap, Tailwind, Material UI, Storybook, ElectronJS.• Backend: NodeJS, Express, NestJS, TypeScript, MongoDB, SQL, Prisma, Socket.IO, Database Design, Microservices, Event-driven Architecture, System Design.• DevOps & Cloud: Linux, Docker, Kubernetes, Helm, NGINX, CI/CD Pipelines, GitHub Actions, Jenkins, AWS, GCP.Fullstack Software Engineer with end-to-end expertise in web development, from frontend and backend to DevOps and deployment. Experienced in delivering full-stack applications using React, Node.js, and cloud platforms. Passionate about contributing to open-source, optimizing development workflows, automating deployments, and creating efficient, maintainable software solutions that scale.

I've worked for numerous local and international start-ups, diving into various technological stacks, communicating and understanding their needs, creating and improving services or entire systems, from small projects to large scale, and successfully achieving their and their users' satisfaction.

Before that and till now, I've been coming up with my own ideas and creating my own applications and solutions to the problems I and the people around me face daily, developing them in public and making them available for free to everyone.

I'm also deeply involved in open source, contributing to public organizations and their projects and participating in open-source initiatives including MLH Fellowship and Google Summer of Code.

My services include:
• Frontend Web Development: Creating websites of various sizes and complexities, from simple landing pages to complex feature-packed dashboards and web applications.
• Backend Development: Creating backend services and APIs to support the frontend, developing the business logic, designing and operating the database, and integrating with third-party services.
• Desktop Apps Development: Creating cross-platform desktop applications that are easy and quick to run and provide more powerful features on the user's device.
• Cloud Hosting & DevOps: Hosting the services on the cloud platforms, advising on the system architecture, and creating CI/CD workflows and automation pipelines.
• Building systems from ideation to MVP and beyond, performing code reviews, updating and fixing existing applications, and more.

Skills:
• Frontend:  HTML, CSS, JavaScript, TypeScript, ReactJS, Redux, NextJS, Bootstrap, Tailwind, Material UI, Storybook, ElectronJS.
• Backend: NodeJS, Express, NestJS, TypeScript, MongoDB, SQL, Prisma, Socket.IO, Database Design, Microservices, Event-driven Architecture, System Design.
• DevOps & Cloud: Linux, Docker, Kubernetes, Helm, NGINX, CI/CD Pipelines, GitHub Actions, Jenkins, AWS, GCP.

designations.3:
Managing & directing the technical academies and events in SemiColon. 

My responsibilities included:
- Planning & taking decisions for the club's technical events, and creating the timeline for the events.
- Managing the technical academies & overviewing the coaching process of the members, ensuring sustained professional & personal development for them and a friendly environment.
- Directly leading the web development academy & their inner teams, participating in mentorship, planning the club's IT projects and systems & ensuring best code practices & using latest tech trends.
designations.4: Skills: Strategic Planning · Team Management · Coaching & Mentoring · Front-End Development · Team Leadership · Project Management · Full-Stack Development

designations.5:
Led the development of the full-stack recruitment system, which includes the registration website, dashboard website, and backend API & database, using React, NodeJS, Express, MongoDB, TypeScript & more.

Digitalized the recruitment process as follows:
• Replaced the need for 80% of the external services needed for the recruitment processes, such as Google Forms & Google Sheets, by implementing participant's state tracking & automatic email sending.
• Removed all needs for paperwork in recruitment processes by developing interview notes & rating features. 
• Implemented security measures such as authentication, authorization, and logging for actions to trace any action done on the system, as well as rate-limiting
• Ensured usage of latest technologies, best practices & code quality, through the usage of TypeScript, reviewing pull requests, adding swagger to the API, etc.
• Hired, instructed & mentored the full-stack development team.

info.3:
We developed a robust DevOps pipeline for the SemiColon Registration System, a Node.js backend application with a MongoDB database, deploying it on Microsoft Azure Cloud using modern DevOps practices.

🔧 Key DevOps highlights:

1. Docker & Docker Compose: We containerized the backend and MongoDB services for multiple environments (development, testing, production). A custom Docker Compose file was designed for testing the application, which is integrated into our Jenkins CI/CD pipeline to automate testing before every deployment.

2. Kubernetes Orchestration: Managed the deployment of services using Kubernetes with a fully automated setup for scaling, load balancing, and handling traffic with ConfigMaps and Ingress rules. We implemented init containers to run tests before the main application starts, ensuring the system is always in a good state.

3. Jenkins CI/CD Pipeline: Our Jenkins pipeline automates the full lifecycle of the application—running tests, building Docker images, and deploying the infrastructure using Terraform and Ansible. The pipeline is built to ensure a smooth and consistent deployment process, handling everything from provisioning to configuration automatically.

4. Terraform Infrastructure-as-Code: We used Terraform to provision the cloud infrastructure on Azure, ensuring consistent and repeatable deployments. This included setting up VMs, virtual networks, public IPs, and security groups, giving us a robust cloud foundation.

5. Ansible Automation: Post-provisioning, Ansible was used to automate server configuration, install Docker, and deploy the application using Docker Compose. This ensured a fully automated end-to-end process, bringing the application online with minimal manual intervention.

6. Slack Integration: We set up real-time Slack notifications to provide instant feedback on pipeline success or failure, allowing us to quickly address any issues and improve efficiency.
info.4: Skills: Docker · Microsoft Azure · Cloud Services · Kubernetes · Jenkins · Cloud Computing · DevOps · Terraform
info.5: DevOps Full Pipeline for Semi-Colon Project.pptx

info.4:
Well designed and fully detailed database for a big restaurant franchise including every detail possible for the database to get close to how it would look like at a real franchise.

- 18 entities and 26 relationships for a total of 35 tables.
- 36 CREATE TABLE queries, 35 ALTER TABLE queries, 10 CREATE VIEW queries.
- 39 INSERT queries for a total of about 700 rows of data respecting all constraints.
- 18 reports (statistical queries) fully implemented.
- Total of 2,000+ lines of SQL.
- The biggest and most ambitious project out of all projects in the database course this semester. (2 to 3 times bigger than the average project)
- Dives deep into the details of a restaurant franchise, such as customers, branches, tables, employees, ingredients, suppliers, menu items, reservations, deliveries, offers, tracking orders, and much more, all with their relationships with each other.

For more details, look at the GitHub repo.
info.5: Skills: Relational Databases · Database Development · Databases · MySQL · SQL
info.7: The complete details and SQL implementation.

info.4:
• Created a backend service to generate on-demand personalized social card images for user profiles and user highlights, to be displayed as previews on links to profiles or highlights on social media platforms.

• The service uses the user data to build an HTML page with Tailwind then transforms it into a PNG image and uploads it to S3 and links it to the frontend.

• Caching is implemented to avoid unnecessary regeneration, by keeping track of the generation date and checking if there are changes to the user’s data.

• Published a dev.to post documenting the challenges faced during development and how we overcame them, from the proof-of-concept till production and integrating with the main website.
info.5: Skills: Amazon Web Services (AWS) · NestJS · Node.js · TypeScript · Tailwind CSS · Back-End Web Development
info.6: Project blog post - Personalized Social Images: Enhancing User Profiles with Opengraph

info.3:
My Submission to the MLH Fellowship Orientation Hackathon

I developed a desktop application designed to optimize folder management with multiple time-saving functionalities. Here are the key features:

- Folder Info 🗃: Get detailed information about folders, including the count of folders and files, the - largest files by size, and the oldest files by creation date.
- Image Compression 🤏: Efficiently compress all images within a folder to save space.
- Deep Image Search 🔎: Locate and list all images within a folder and its subfolders, making it easier to find deeply nested images.
- Subfolder Extraction 📤: Consolidate all files from subfolders into a single directory for easier access.

This application was built as a web application and transformed into a desktop application using Electron.js. The frontend was developed with React and TypeScript, while Node.js powered the app's functionalities.
info.4: Skills: HTML5 · Electron.js · JavaScript · Node.js · TypeScript · React.js

info.3:
• A desktop web application that is a visual drag-and-drop editor that designs user interfaces for games made in Warcraft III platform, using graphical elements only and without any code from the user. Uses ElectronJs and TypeScript.
• Helped eliminate any need for users to learn coding & significantly reduced the difficulty of creating UI and cut down the time consumed in that process.
• All systems were made from scratch, including Undo/Redo, Save/Load, code generation for 3 languages, elements dragging and mechanisms, element hierarchy management, and more.
• Has over 2,000 downloads, and is well-known in the platform's community.

Github Link: https://github.com/nightknighto/Warcraft-3-Reforged-UI-Maker
info.4: Skills: HTML5 · Electron.js · Object-Oriented Programming (OOP) · JavaScript · GitHub · Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) · Front-End Development · Git · Node.js · TypeScript · Software Design Patterns · HTML

info.3:
• Developed a cross-platform desktop application using Electron, ReactJS, TypeScript & Bootstrap.
• Created a user-friendly Graphical User Interface (GUI) for managing [ASUENG Library] courses' data saved in JSON format.
• Designed and implemented specialized systems from scratch tailored to specific use cases, including a JSON Viewer that effectively parses and displays JSON data with controls, enabling non-developers to contribute by modifying course data without directly handling raw JSON.

Features:
• JSON Viewer: Parses and displays JSON data in a user-friendly manner.
• Schema-Based Parsing: Parses JSON files according to a predefined data schema and saves modifications.
• Folder Analysis: Analyzes desktop folders, generates data representations, and supports notes, sources, and credits from special file names.
• Course Data Generation: Quickly converts existing folder structures into course data.
• Data Organization: Allows adding, editing, and deleting folders, files, notes, and sources.
• Academic Year Assignment: Organizes data by assigning academic years to folders, files, and notes.
• Error Detection: Identifies and displays errors or warnings for invalid inputs, highlighting problematic data in the JSON Viewer.
• Metadata Display: Shows metadata such as folder count, file count, and number of warnings and errors.
info.4: Skills: Bootstrap · HTML5 · Electron.js · JavaScript · GitHub · Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) · Front-End Development · Git · Node.js · TypeScript · React.js · HTML
